reviewText:
Product received for free

Game has a sort of a hidden object point and click  look and feel to it.
But it doesn't have the find 10 objects" screens
date:
it's more of a tradtional point 'n' click.

You find items in the game to use and some you have to combine in your inventory.
The graphics/art are well done and it looks good for this type of game.
Some of the characters are high res. which does look good .

It would useful to have some tips or info about the story or what one is supposed to do.

Also it  was very annoying having to start from the beginning eveytime i died
recommended: maybe that's part of the challenge
hoursPlayed:
i dunno.
Overall a well made game but It would useful to have some tips or info about the story or what one is supposed to do.
But maybe that's just me not understanding what is going on or what i'm supposed to be doing.

Is it worth playing ? I would say yes
but hope to see some small improvements in the future."
votesTotal: 7 of 11 people (64%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Rescue Lucy is very great point and click game, I enjoying while playing in it :) There beautiful art and soundtrack. Also, here a good mystery atmosphere with interesting puzzles. I hope, you rescue Lucy from this dangerous adventure
voteText: 7 of 11 people (64%) found this review helpful

reviewText: High-resolution first-person Flash-based point-and-click, super spooky. Much better made than your average Flash game or item hunt. Spooky pretty ambient music, this game's pretty good.
voteText: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Rescue Lucy was a short and enjoyable experience, the art and soundtrack is beautiful.  Is not much story or scenes but the challenge is that literally no hints or help throughout the whole game.\n\nThe items didn't have any descriptions, so I ended wandering around the mansion and randomly use a item, except of that, I love the atmosphere and monsters ! ♥

I really liked the atmosphere and all that mistery around. The art is ultra-awesome. Audio is also nice. Thou I really recommend some text tips and dialogue, that would bring more life and meaning to all those items and monsters.\nI still didn't find Lucy.

reviewText: Creepy atmosphere,well done graphics and it cool story.\n\nGreat Work!

reviewText: Rescue Lucy is an atmospheric point & click. The art is okay and the music is just great.\nYou play as a little girl who has just lost her dog Lucy. You investigate the mysteries of a dark forest and all the creatures in it. You should not expect 10h+ of gameplay, but at the cost of €3, you really cannot go wrong with this one.
